keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Alison Smale and Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: At least one of the people named in the Brussels attack had been deported by Turkey with indications that he was a jihadist.

headline.print_headline: Europe’s Intelligence Stalls at the Borders
headline.main: As Terrorists Cross Borders, Europe Sees Anew That Its Intelligence Does Not

snippet: At least one of the people named in the Brussels attack had been deported by Turkey with indications that he was a jihadist.
abstract: Revelation that Ibrahim el-Bakraoui, one of perpetrators of terrorist attacks in Brussels, was deported by Turkey in 2015 underscores how European nations' intelligence services seem to be limited by national boundaries, even as Islamic State group operates in coordinated way across those same borders; attacks have renewed calls for pan-European intelligence agency to more effectively combat terrorist threat.
